page.title: 03FARMING LIFE IN SWINFORD
page.content:
A typical working day of one{farming {family}living in the village. The family consists of the farmer and his wife who both work on the farm and two children who attend the village primary school. Both children give occasional help with farm work, particularly with stock rearing. Only one{farmhand}is employed.
{ 6.00 a.m.}Get up-milk cows { 8.00 a.m.}Feed calves and cattle { 9.00 a.m.}Adults feed,children school { 9.30 a.m.}Tend cattle, hay and silage {11.00 a.m.}Shepherding, field work { 1.00 p.m.}Dinner with children { 2.00 p.m.}Seasonal outside work { 3.30 p.m.}Children home { 4.30 p.m.}Feed cattle { 7.00 p.m.}Evening meal {10.00 p.m.}Check cows {11.00 p.m.}Bed time
